cold_Fusion wrote:
Just wanted to point out a small problem I found with this. After I installed the pk4 file, I noticed that the spawn decal (the one that appears when demons are teleported) is messed up in-game. I deleted the pk4 file, and the problem was fixed. I'm not sure if it's the same in V2, I haven't tried it yet.


Damm... you mean the "textures/decals/spawndecal" material right?
(and yes it's the same in V2, don't bother to DL it)

I checked and I noticed that it's commented out when I should have left it in... A result of my indecision at a time when I was juggling whether or not I should comment those out or not: before I decided to use the "dontuse.tga" qer_editorimage and before I learned about the vertexcolor parameter. This broke the methodical verification flow and caused this oversight. Matt, I should have listened to you from the beginning... damm that bloody temper of mine

Oh well... Version 3 is now up. I don't mind doing the fixes and re-uploading. What bugs me is that I feel bad for the users having to re-download a 13MB pak every time and I feel like a heel for abusing pcgamemod's storage space this way.

I've re-verified the entire textures/decals family to be sure there weren't any others. Thanks for the feedback cold_Fusion, this is exactly what I need to make this thing as error-free as I can

Oh BTW, you don't need to delete the pk4 when a problem occurs, just temporarily rename to .zip and the Doom3 game won't see it. Also, if you want, you can fix it yourself easily without having to download a new version (assuming you already have V2). Here's how:

- rename the pk4 to .zip and double-click on it to open the file in wizip
- scroll to the file decals.mtr, right-click on it and select "view with NOTEPAD.EXE"
- scroll down to where the material "textures/decals/spawndecal" is
- remove the // at the beginning of every line of that shader/material
- edit the qer_editorimage parameter to "textures/editor/dontuse.tga"
- save the file and close it, Winzip will notice the file has changed and ask you if you want to update the archive. Choose YES.
- that's it, your pak file is fixed. Just rename it to .pk4 again and you're ready to go

But if you have a broadband connection and don't mind DL'ing a 13MB file:
http://www.pcgamemods.com/7561/
